articles.title: Pegasus, All Bets Are On, Samuel L. Jackson

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: "CBS Weekend News" headlines for Sunday, March 24, 2019
articles.description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Weekend News" with Elaine Quijano.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: 3/24: CBS Evening News
articles.description: Trump calls Mueller report an "illegal takedown that failed"; Robert Kraft issues first public statement after solicitation charges

articles.author: Danielle Garrand
articles.title: "Clueless" cast reunites nearly 25 years after film's release
articles.description: Fans of the iconic '90s hit were, "totally buggin'"
articles.content:
Stars of the iconic '90s romantic comedy "Clueless" reunited Saturday at a panel during the Chicago Comic & Entertainment Expo (C2E2). And fans of the hit were, "totally buggin'."
Alicia Silverstone (Cher Horowitz), Paul Rudd (Josh Lucas), Donald Faison … [+2372 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Robert Kraft issues first public statement after solicitation charges
articles.description: New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft is speaking out for the first time since being charged in a Florida prostitution investigation. This weekend, he will be with other NFL owners and could face disciplinary action. Tony Dokoupil reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Police: Another Parkland shooting survivor dies in "apparent suicide"
articles.description: A second student who survived the Parkland shooting in Florida has died in an apparent suicide, police said. This comes about a week after a 19-year old survivor took her own life. Manuel Bojorquez reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Will legalized sports betting curtail corruption or encourage it?
articles.description: With more states legalizing gambling on sports, bookmakers, leagues and state tax revenues are winning big. But will players -- particularly unpaid college players -- be targets for bribery? Jon Wertheim reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Samuel L. Jackson: A long, vigorous career still in full stride
articles.description: At age 70, when most actors find it hard to get work, Samuel L. Jackson is much in demand. Jackson creates memorable characters: strong, raw, credible, and sometimes scary. Steve Kroft reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Probes into Trump's business and campaign finances still ongoing
articles.description: There are more investigations after the release of the Mueller report. The President could face his most serious legal problems in New York. Jeff Pegues reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: CEO of Israeli spyware-maker NSO on fighting terror, Khashoggi murder and Saudi Arabia
articles.description: An Israeli company licenses software around the world that can crack just about any smartphone, but is its use always on the side of good? Lesley Stahl reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Norway cruise ship reaches port with all passengers and crew safe
articles.description: Accompanied by tug boats, the Viking Sky cruise ship limped into a Norwegian port more than a day after issuing a mayday call in a storm that led to harrowing helicopter rescues. Jonathan Vigliotti reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Trump calls Mueller report an "illegal takedown that failed"
articles.description: Robert Mueller's special counsel investigation turned up no evidence that the Trump campaign conspired or coordinated with Russia in 2016. On the issue of obstruction of justice, Mueller did not conclude the president committed a crime but did not exonerate h…

articles.title: Driver working with NBC News killed in explosion in Syria
articles.description: The U.S.-backed Syrian Democratic Front declared victory over ISIS​ earlier Saturday
articles.content:
A local driver with NBC News was killed in Syria when a device exploded, the company's president said in a statement. The device exploded in the vicinity of an NBC News crew, but none of the NBC employees were injured in the blast.

articles.title: Powerball jackpot jumps to $625 million ahead of drawing
articles.description: The estimated lump sum payout would be $380.6 million before taxes
articles.content:
An estimated $625 million jackpot is on the line in Saturday's Powerball drawing. It would be the seventh-highest U.S. lottery jackpot ever. 
The estimated lump sum payout would be $380.6 million before taxes. The odds of winning are roughly 1 in 292.2 milli… [+436 chars]
